App-V Recipes

Here’s a list of App-V recipes, tips and other resources available from Microsoft and the App-V community to assist with sequencing applications:

Where to find information on sequencing

These guides should be followed when sequencing an application and will assist in creating a successful App-V package:

  • Microsoft App-V 5.0 Sequencing Guide
  • Microsoft Application Virtualization 4.6 SP1 Sequencing Guide
  • Microsoft Application Virtualization 4.6 Sequencing Guide
  • Best practices to use for sequencing in Microsoft SoftGrid

These locations host some excellent information for sequencing applications:

  • Application Virtualization (App-V) forum on the TechNet Forums
  • Sequencing on AppVirtGuru.com
  • ITNinja.com has details about silent installs which also includes instructions for virtualizing many packages

Support Statements

Some vendors have released official support statements for their products running under various application virtualization products:

  • Known issues when creating or using an App-V 5.0 Office 2010 package
  • Supported scenarios for deploying Microsoft Office as a sequenced App-V Package
  • Description of the support policy for Microsoft programs that are running in a Microsoft SoftGrid Application Virtualization environment
  • Description of the support policy for versions of Office that are running in SoftGrid Application Virtualization
  • Client virtualization support for the Lync 2010 client and the Lync 2010 Group Chat client
  • Support for the Microsoft unified communications clients in Application Virtualization environments
  • Will Microsoft FRx Work With Microsoft SoftGrid?
  • The support policy for third-party applications that run in a SoftGrid Application Virtualization environment
  • Message: ‘Invalid license data’ Sequencing SQL Server Business Intelligence Development Studio (BIDS) with App-V
  • Attachmate Products and Virtualization Platforms
  • Is there Microsoft App-V support for IBM SPSS Statistics Client product
  • Using Microsoft App-V to Deploy the Zephyr PASSPORT Terminal Emulator

Here on stealthpuppy.com

I have a number of App-V recipes documented on this site:

  • Sequencing Mozilla Firefox with App-V 5.x
  • Sequencing Apple iTunes 11 with App-V 5
  • Sequencing Mozilla Firefox with App-V 4.6
  • Sequencing Mozilla Firefox 8
  • Sequencing Google Chrome 15
  • Sequencing Mozilla Firefox 7
  • Sequencing Mozilla Firefox 5
  • Sequencing Apple iTunes 10
  • Sequencing Microsoft Comic Chat
  • Sequencing the App-V Management Console
  • Virtualising Adobe Reader X
  • Virtualising Apple Safari 5
  • Virtualising Paint.NET 3.x
  • Virtualising OpenOffice.org 3.x (lists the Sun Java Runtime Environment too)
  • Virtualising Firefox? Don’t forget to disable Updates
  • Virtualising QuickTime 7.x
  • Juggling Sun Java Runtimes in App-V
  • Running the latest Oracle JInitiator
  • Sequencing Adobe Photoshop CS3
  • Sequencing Adobe Illustrator CS3
  • Sequencing Adobe InDesign CS3

Community Driven App-V Recipes and Tips Feed

[Update – Feb 2016] I’ve now closed my Delicious account since Delicious started showing unsolicited ads in the App-V recipe feeds. The entire list of tips and recipes is available here in a single static page: App-V Recipes and Tips

I maintain a list of completed recipes plus various resources and recommendations for virtualizing applications with App-V, which you can view here – App-V Recipe bookmarks. Subscribe to this feed to keep up to date with new resources:

App-V Recipes and Tips feed

To search for a recipe, follow these steps:

  1. Go to http://www.delicious.com
  2. Click the Search box
  3. Type the name of the application plus “@aaronparker” (without quotes)

For example, to find resources on virtualizing Firefox, type “firefox @aaronparker” (without the quotes).
